name: Convert JSON palette with named indexes to numbers

in_ports.name: json_palette
json_named_indexes
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] JSON with a table of several numbers (INDEXes in the result), listed by their symbolic names.
It consists of pairs:
"KEY": xxx
where KEY is a symbolic name, xxx is an integer non-negative number, represented in keys of "json_palette" under this name.

out_ports.name: palette
out_ports.hint: Numeric multi-column table, equivalent to the source "json_palette".

controls.caption: Number of result channels
controls.name: numberOfChannels
controls.description: Number of columns in the result array. Usually should be 1 (grayscale palette), 3 (RGB-palette) or 4 (RGBA-palette).

controls.name: defaultColor
controls.caption: Default color
controls.description:
Default color, used for indexes, which are absent in JSON palette, for example, when indexing base is 0, but the minimal index in JSON is 10.
Supported color formats:
    #FF0000 — HTML standard RRGGBBB without alpha (red color)
    #FF000080 — HTML standard RRGGBBBAA with alpha (red color with alpha 0.5)
    0xFF0000 — hexadecimal RRGGBBB, alpha not allowed (red color)
    (1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.5) — all channels (normalized to 0.0..1.0), alpha allowed (red color with alpha 0.5)
    [255, 173, 0] — raw (non-normalized) values for each channels, alpha allowed
    0.5 — grayscale (normalized to 0.0..1.0)

controls.caption: Default value for extra channels
controls.name: defaultValueForExtraChannels
controls.description: Color format above allows to specify only 1, 3 or 4 channels (including alpha-channel). If you specify number of channels >4, all other channels in the result will be filled by this value.

controls.caption: Indexing base of result palette
controls.name: indexingBase
controls.description:
For every index K in the source "json_table", the corresponding value will be stored in the result array in the block (row) #K−B, where B = this parameter.
Note: indexes in "json_table" must not be less than this indexing base.
